column3: as the Hedgehog's Wife was ready they set out together; and on the way he said
column4: "Now attend to what I say. On the long field yonder we shall decide our bet. The Hare is to run on the one side of the hedge and I on the other
column5: and so all you have to do is to stop at one end of the hedge
column6: and then when the Hare arrives on the other side at the same point
column8: ‘I am here already.'"They soon came to the field
column9: and the Hedgehog stationed himself at one end of the hedge
column10: and his Wife at the other end; and as soon as they had taken their places the Hare arrived. "Are you ready to start?" asked the Hare. "Yes
column11: answered the Hedgehog, and each took his place. Off once
column13: three times and off!" cried the Hare
column14: and ran up the field like a whirlwind; while the Hedgehog took three steps and then returned to his place.
